title: Titan of terror: The dark imagination of H.P. Lovecraft - Silvia Moreno-Garc√≠a

multiple-choice.question: Where was Howard Phillips Lovecraft born?

options.label: A
options.text: New York City, New York

options.label: B
options.text: Providence, Rhode Island

options.label: C
options.text: Boston, Massachusetts

options.label: D
options.text: Chicago, Illinois

multiple-choice.question: Which authors' Gothic horror stories did Lovecraft admire?

options.label: A
options.text: Edgar Allan Poe and Robert Chambers

options.label: B
options.text: Robert E. Howard and Robert Bloch

options.label: C
options.text: Mary Shelley and Bram Stoker

options.label: D
options.text: H.P. Lovecraft and Stephen King

multiple-choice.question: What impact did World War I have on the arts, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to a renewed interest in fantastical folklore.

options.label: B
options.text: It had no significant impact on the arts.

options.label: C
options.text: It cast a long shadow over the arts, making people less frightened of fantastical folklore.

options.label: D
options.text: It led to a decline in the popularity of horror stories due to increased interest in romance novels.

multiple-choice.question: In Lovecraft's stories, what often lends eerie plausibility to the terror?

options.label: A
options.text: Supernatural elements

options.label: B
options.text: Scientific elements

options.label: C
options.text: Historical events

options.label: D
options.text: Mythological creatures

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the shared universe created by Lovecraft and his contemporaries?

options.label: A
options.text: The Lovecraftian Universe

options.label: B
options.text: The Cthulhu Mythos

options.label: C
options.text: The Horrorverse

options.label: D
options.text: The Dark Realm of the Ancients

multiple-choice.question: What is the nature of the terror in "Lovecraftian" horror, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: It lies in graphic violence and startling shocks.

options.label: B
options.text: It lies in recognizable monsters and supernatural creatures.

options.label: C
options.text: It lies in what's not directly portrayed, but left to the imagination.

options.label: D
options.text: It lies in the use of historical events to create a sense of unease.

multiple-choice.question: How did Lovecraft's personal views affect his work?

options.label: A
options.text: They had no impact on his work.

options.label: B
options.text: They added depth and complexity to his stories.

options.label: C
options.text: They led to the inclusion of crude stereotypes and slurs in some of his works.

options.label: D
options.text: They made his stories more appealing to a wider audience due to their neutrality.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of Lovecraft's correspondence with other writers?

options.label: A
options.text: They ignored his suggestions and created their own separate universes.

options.label: B
options.text: They adopted his ideas and created a shared universe.

options.label: C
options.text: They criticized his work and refused to collaborate with him.

options.label: D
options.text: They only communicated with him about non-literary topics.

multiple-choice.question: How has the Cthulhu Mythos been reimagined by authors after Lovecraft's death?

options.label: A
options.text: They have remained faithful to Lovecraft's original vision and prejudices.

options.label: B
options.text: They have abandoned the Cthulhu Mythos and created new universes.

options.label: C
options.text: They have reimagined it from diverse perspectives that transcend Lovecraft's prejudices.

options.label: D
options.text: They have only used the Cthulhu Mythos as a basis for comedy and satire.

multiple-choice.question: What is the enduring appeal of Lovecraftian horror, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: Its ability to evoke a sense of triumph and victory over evil.

options.label: B
options.text: Its use of recognizable monsters and supernatural creatures.

options.label: C
options.text: Its ability to tap into human dread about the unknown future.

options.label: D
options.text: Its reliance on historical events to create a sense of unease.

title: The hidden network that makes the internet possible - Sajan Saini

multiple-choice.question: What material is primarily used in fiber optic cables to transmit data as pulses of light?

options.label: A
options.text: Copper

options.label: B
options.text: Glass

options.label: C
options.text: Silicon

options.label: D
options.text: Metal

multiple-choice.question: What phenomenon allows light to travel within glass fiber strands, enabling efficient data transmission?

options.label: A
options.text: Refraction

options.label: B
options.text: Total internal reflection

options.label: C
options.text: Diffraction

options.label: D
options.text: Interference

multiple-choice.question: What is the main advantage of using fiber optic signals compared to electricity or radio signals for long-distance communication?

options.label: A
options.text: Higher data rates

options.label: B
options.text: Lower power consumption

options.label: C
options.text: Less signal degradation over long distances

options.label: D
options.text: Increased security

multiple-choice.question: What term describes the network of remote servers accessed over the internet to store, manage, and process data, often relying on fiber optic connections?

options.label: A
options.text: Cloud computing

options.label: B
options.text: Data center

options.label: C
options.text: Fiber optic network

options.label: D
options.text: Integrated photonics

multiple-choice.question: What significant problem is associated with traditional electrical cables used in data centers, which can be mitigated by using fiber optic connections?

options.label: A
options.text: Limited bandwidth

options.label: B
options.text: High power consumption

options.label: C
options.text: Heat waste

options.label: D
options.text: Data security

multiple-choice.question: How do photonic chips help address the issue of heat waste in data centers, improving overall efficiency?

options.label: A
options.text: By increasing server efficiency

options.label: B
options.text: By reducing power consumption

options.label: C
options.text: By converting electrical signals to optical signals

options.label: D
options.text: By improving cooling systems

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary benefit of using terahertz frequencies in wireless communication, and how does it compare to traditional gigahertz signals?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased range

options.label: B
options.text: Higher data rates

options.label: C
options.text: Improved security

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced power consumption

multiple-choice.question: Why are terahertz signals limited in their range, and what technology can be used to relay them over longer distances?

options.label: A
options.text: They are blocked by tall buildings and absorbed by moisture in the air, and can be relayed using photonic chips and optical fiber.

options.label: B
options.text: They are scattered by atmospheric particles and can be amplified using repeaters.

options.label: C
options.text: They are attenuated by distance and can be boosted using amplifiers.

options.label: D
options.text: They are limited by the curvature of the Earth and can be relayed using satellites.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of integrated photonics in the development of fiber optic technology, enabling advancements in data transmission and processing?

options.label: A
options.text: It enables the creation of longer fiber optic cables.

options.label: B
options.text: It allows for the miniaturization of fiber optic devices.

options.label: C
options.text: It improves the efficiency of fiber optic signals.

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the data rates of fiber optic transmission.

multiple-choice.question: How has the widespread adoption of fiber optics impacted the development of the internet and global communication, transforming the way we interact and access information?

options.label: A
options.text: It has increased the reliance on traditional electrical cables.

options.label: B
options.text: It has limited the growth of cloud computing and mobile devices.

options.label: C
options.text: It has enabled the creation of a planetary computer and expanded virtual world.

options.label: D
options.text: It has reduced the need for data centers and servers.
